text:
have you tried `{% for row in hubdb_table_rows(1043163, '&limit=1') %}`
since the second parameter acts like a query string
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/get_table_rows> has some more info
<@UAQHN1F2Q> Can u remove the space between ( and 1043163 and try?
tested it with my own module that does a similar hubdb call, the spaces didn't affect it
What is the problem u r facing? this error Error parsing 'hubdb_table_rows(,1627546,'&limit=1')': syntax error at position 28, encountered ',', expected ')'?
When I removed the space, this error disappeared.

well, you have a `,` before your table ID so that's the likely reason you were receiving an error.
either way, my response was for Sam since his was about trying to get the hubdb filters to work
oh ok. He facing the same error as i had.
<@U89DUQGKD> remove the sapce between ( and 1043163 and try
s'all good. hopefully this helped you as well
Hi <@UG52C29EE> Yep, I was working with Matt and he found that same issue. It worked just fine after removing those spaces. Thanks for the reply!
